explainability.findings: Policy documents commit to AI assurance processes covering explainability. These documents also outline mechanisms for ensuring explainability principles are met.
explainability.path_to_improvement: Publish user-facing explanation interfaces or documented appeal workflows.

relevant_sources.summary: This policy document, "Artificial Intelligence Vision," provides evidence for **governance**, **explainability**, and **fairness**. It establishes AI governance functions and an AI Governance Council for oversight, demonstrating strong support for the **governance** pillar. The document also commits to AI assurance processes covering explainability, ethics, bias, and fairness, directly supporting the **explainability** and **fairness** pillars by outlining mechanisms for ensuring these principles are met.
relevant_sources.title: Artificial Intelligence Vision

relevant_sources.summary: This Amgen Form 10-K filing provides evidence for **explainability, external_accountability, fairness, governance, oversight, privacy, and transparency**. The document supports these pillars by referencing AI regulations like the EU AI Act, which mandates transparency, human oversight, and accountability. It also details the establishment of an AI Governance Council, the implementation of guardrails and training to mitigate privacy risks, and acknowledges the need for fairness by addressing flawed AI outputs due to data or algorithm issues.
relevant_sources.title: 2024 Form 10-K – AI Tools and Risk Disclosure

external_accountability.findings: Privacy policy documents mention an AI authority and outline user rights and review options. Company filings also reference AI regulations that mandate accountability.
external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Publish third-party audit results, certifications, or regulatory compliance documentation.

relevant_sources.summary: This privacy policy document provides evidence for **transparency**, **fairness**, **governance**, **oversight**, and **external accountability**. It supports transparency by stating the use of an AI tool for interview scheduling and commits to bias mitigation and human oversight for AI systems. The policy also indicates governance and external accountability by mentioning an AI authority and outlining user rights and review options.
relevant_sources.title: Careers Privacy Statement – AI-Assisted Decision-Making

fairness.findings: Policy documents commit to AI assurance processes covering bias and fairness, outlining mechanisms to ensure these principles are met. Company blog posts describe ongoing testing for bias mitigation, and privacy policy documents also commit to bias mitigation for AI systems. Additionally, company filings acknowledge the need for fairness by addressing flawed AI outputs due to data or algorithm issues.

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned blog post, "Eva AI Assistant for Patient Access & Reimbursement," provides evidence for fairness, governance, oversight, privacy, and transparency. It supports governance and oversight by describing AI impact assessments, a risk-management program with continuous oversight, and ongoing testing for accuracy and bias mitigation. The post also supports privacy by specifying that AI training excludes Protected Health Information (PHI), and it reiterates commitments to transparency and accountability in AI applications.

governance.findings: Privacy policy documents and company filings detail the establishment of an AI Governance Council, which enforces controls and monitors AI, alongside mandatory AI training. Company blog posts discuss data sharing for AI, implying governance needs for protecting sensitive information, and describe a structured approach to AI application in clinical trial design and participant identification. Furthermore, company blog posts describe AI impact assessments and a risk-management program, while privacy policy documents mention an AI authority. Press releases highlight a commitment to AI deployment and collaboration, and company blog posts highlight the need for expertise to focus on real-world problems in biotechnology.

relevant_sources.summary: This policy document, "Artificial Intelligence Vision," provides evidence for **governance**, **explainability**, and **fairness**. relevant_sources.title: Artificial Intelligence Vision

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned privacy policy document, "Cybersecurity and Data Privacy – Trustworthy AI Governance," provides evidence for the **governance** and **privacy** pillars. It supports governance by detailing the establishment of an AI Governance Council that enforces controls and monitors AI, alongside mandatory AI training. The document also supports privacy by outlining Amgen's cybersecurity and data privacy programs and controls for protecting personal data.
relevant_sources.title: Cybersecurity and Data Privacy – Trustworthy AI Governance

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned blog post provides evidence for the **privacy**, **transparency**, and **governance** pillars of responsible AI. It supports the privacy pillar by mentioning federated learning for data protection and discusses data sharing for AI, implying privacy needs. Transparency is supported by the mention of federated learning for AI/ML model improvement and the description of a trusted party involved in ML training and data sharing. The governance pillar is touched upon through the discussion of data sharing for AI and the implication of governance needs for protecting sensitive information.
relevant_sources.title: How AI Is Revolutionizing Protein Drug Development

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned blog post, "Clinical Trial Optimization with Data and AI," provides evidence for the **governance** pillar. relevant_sources.summary: This company blog post provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. relevant_sources.summary: This press release announces a partnership between Amgen and Mila to apply AI to drug discovery, providing evidence for **governance** by highlighting a commitment to AI deployment and collaboration. summary.overall_findings: Amgen's published materials demonstrate operational practices in areas such as transparency, where company documents mention federated learning for AI/ML model improvement, and governance, detailing the establishment of an AI Governance Council. All 7 evaluated pillars have documented public evidence, with privacy policy documents outlining cybersecurity and data privacy programs, and fairness policy documents committing to AI assurance processes covering bias and fairness. Additionally, explainability and external accountability are addressed at the policy level; for instance, policy documents outline mechanisms for ensuring explainability principles are met, and privacy policy documents mention an AI authority. This assessment draws on 16 publicly available sources.
